byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma contributed reporting from Kathmandu, Nepal.

abstract: More than 5,000 schools in Nepal were damaged in April 25 earthquake, and as many as 1,000 collapsed in latest temblor; government is constructing 7,000 temporary learning centers and replacing damaged schools, but officials say they cannot hope to replace them all before May 29.
lead_paragraph: Officials say that thousands of schools have been destroyed and that tens of thousands of classrooms need replacing, even as aftershocks continue.

headline.main: Nepal School System Left Shattered in Aftermath of Quake
headline.print_headline: Nepal’s School System Is Shattered by Quakes
